title: Tito Lupini
text:
Tito Lupini (12 November 1955 – 23 July 2021) was a South African-born Italian <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> player who played as a prop.
Biography.
Born and raised in South Africa by Italian parents, Lupini as a player represented the provincial team of <a href="Golden%20Lions">Transvaal</a>. After the appointment of former <a href="Springboks">Springboks</a> coach <a href="Nelie%20Smith">Nelie Smith</a> for <a href="Rugby%20Rovigo">Rugby Rovigo</a>, he moved to Italy in 1985 and played for <a href="Rugby%20Rovigo%20Delta">Rovigo</a>, in whose first row constituted a key element (also being Captain of the team) for the achievement of two national titles (1988 and 1990), alongside fellow south africans <a href="Naas%20Botha">Naas Botha</a> and <a href="Gert%20Smal">Gert Smal</a>. In the 1989–90 season, won by Rovigo, Lupini had the double role of player and coach. During his time in Italy, he helped Rovigo reaching the final twice (1989 and 1992), the semifinal (1991) and a quarter final (1993). The Smith-Lupini-Botha-Smal era is still fondly remembered in <a href="Rovigo">Rovigo</a>, the most rugby addicted city in Italy, for the impact it had in ending a 9 years winning drought for the team.
International career.
Debuting for the <a href="Italy%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Italian national team</a> in the <a href="1985-87%20FIRA%20Trophy">1985-87 FIRA Trophy</a> against <a href="Romania%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Romania</a> at <a href="Constan%C5%A3a">Constanţa</a>, <a href="Socialist%20Republic%20of%20Romania">Socialist Republic of Romania</a>, Lupini was called up by the then-coach <a href="Marco%20Bollesan">Marco Bollesan</a> in the roster which took part in the <a href="1987%20Rugby%20World%20Cup">first edition</a> of the <a href="Rugby%20World%20Cup">Rugby World Cup</a>, playing all the three matches where Italy played.
Coaching career.
After his retirement from the playing career in 1992, Lupini started his coaching career, coaching Rovigo, leading the team to the final for the national championship (then lost) against <a href="Benetton%20Rugby">Benetton Treviso</a> in 1992. He also coached the forwards for the <a href="Namibia%20national%20rugby%20union%20team">Namibia national team</a> and the same role for Rovigo.
